description:
Black resin case. Black polyurethane strap. Black dial. Stainless steel caseback. Mineral crystal. Tang clasp. Quartz movement. Water resistant at 50 meters (165 feet). Nike Triax Blaze Junior Unisex Watch WK0008-001
The Nike Triax Blaze kids' analog watch is designed to absorb playground punishment and get your rugrat back home in time for dinner with its large, easy-to-read dial face. It offers an aluminum face shield that takes blows without flinching and a stainless steel buckle and back plate that can withstand serious play. The black watch case and black pre-curved polyurethane strap form a unique S-shaped design that curves comfortably around the wrist for an improved fit and quicker reading of the time.
The black dial face is accented by large, luminous baton-style hands (with seconds hand), Arabic numeral markers (with larger font size at the quarter hours), and small minute indexes. Other features include water resistance to 50 meters (165 feet) and a scratch-resistant mineral glass crystal.
About Nike At its core, Nike understands the need for play, no matter what your age. And as Nike co-founder Bill Bowerman would say--if you have a body, you're an athlete. Nike's line of youth watches blends the advanced materials and drive for excellence built into the company's adult watches with the same mix of sophistication, guts, and imagination as the kids who wear them. They made to fit kid-sized wrists and sport fun, contemporary designs that will look great in school and out on the playfield.
Beyond shoes--from watches and eyewear to carry gear and even socks--Nike is committed to giving athletes of every make, model and body style, who compete and recreate in ways never before imagined, the very best performance product. Here are just a few important dates in Nike's journey:  American record-holder Steve Prefontaine becomes the first major track athlete to wear Nike brand shoes in 1973. At the 1976 Olympic Trials, Nike shoes are seen in abundance for the first time--worn by young, rising stars in both middle- and long-distance events. The first athlete to win an Olympic medal wearing Nike shoes is British runner, Steve Ovett in the 1980 Moscow Games The Just Do It advertising campaign began in 1988, and is now ensconced in the Americana exhibit at the Smithsonian National Museum.
summary: The Nike Triax Blaze Junior Unisex Watch is a durable kids' analog watch designed with a large dial for easy reading. It features a black resin case, black polyurethane strap, stainless steel caseback, mineral crystal, tang clasp, and quartz movement. With water resistance up to 50 meters, it is suitable for swimming and showering.

description: In 1916, the Keds brand was introduced by the U.S. Rubber Company as the first national athletic and lifestyle footwear brand. At this time, the shoes were called sneakers, a term invented in late 1916 by Keds advertising agency because the rubber soles made the shoes quiet. Worn by Olympic soccer players, scores of National and International tennis champions, and many college athletes, Keds was coined the shoe of champions because of its reputation as America's premier athletic brand. Not only was Keds a leading athletic brand, it was also the brand of choice for leading style icons due to its classic, stylish, and authentic characteristics.
summary: Keds, established in 1916, are iconic sneakers known as 'the shoe of champions.' Boasting a classic style, they combine stretch synthetic, a rubber sole, stitch and perforation details, a cotton jersey lining, a charm lace keeper, and a sparkle mesh collar, offering both athleticism and fashion in a compact and lightweight design (9.8 x 5.9 x 3.8 inches, 1.45 pounds).

Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: Retro Minnie Mouse watch with a polished steel case, red leather strap, Minnie Mouse image on the dial, and an oversized cabochon crown with an initial M.

Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: Vintage collectible Barbie watch adorned with the iconic doll's image, featuring a blue and white dial and light blue suede strap, presented in a nostalgic Barbie tin. Crafted by Casio, known for its cutting-edge timepieces and advanced features like solar-powered and Bluetooth technology.

description:
Disney Unisex #MC2092LE
Celebrate the magic of the classic story of Narnia with this Amazon.com Exclusive limited edition collectible timepiece.  This unique watch is designed to represent the special vial containing magical healing properties that was given to Lucy by Father Christmas.  The watch has an antiqued goldtone finish and comes tucked inside a red leather pouch that loops over a matching strap with a buckle closure.  Unsnap the pouch, and you can actually pull the watch out.  It's small, measuring about an inch in wide, and unusually thick, with a substantial feel.  The crown, placed at the top center as on a pocket watch, resembles the lid of the vial, and small "bubbles" between the watch crystal and the recessed dial create the illusion of liquid inside.  The textured silvery-white dial features elegant goldtone breguet hands, a seconds hand, and Roman numerals at the quarter hours.  This watch comes packaged in a beautiful wood veneer box with a velvety red interior and a glass lid.  It is one of a limited edition of 1000 available exclusively through Amazon.com.  Also included is a certificate of authenticity that tells the story of Lucy's bravery and heroism.
summary: Limited-edition Disney timepiece inspired by Narnia's healing vial, featuring an antiqued goldtone finish, textured dial with Roman numerals, and a small, heavy design. description: About Hanes HanesBrands is a socially responsible manufacturer and marketer of leading everyday basic apparel under some of the world's strongest apparel brands in the Americas, Europe and Asia, as well as in Australia and South Africa. Our iconic innerwear and activewear apparel brands found in the United States and elsewhere include include Hanes, Champion, Playtex, Bali, Maidenform, JMS/Just My Size, Wonderbra and Gear for Sports. Outside the United States, we also have dominant national and regional brands, including DIM, Nur Die/Nur Der, Lovable, Abanderado, Shock Absorber, Zorba, Sol y Oro, Rinbros, Track N Field and Ritmo.  We are the worlds largest marketer of basic apparel. We sell bras, panties, shapewear, sheer hosiery, men's underwear, children's underwear, socks, T-shirts, sweatshirts, fleece and other activewear. In the United States, we sell more units of intimate apparel, male underwear, socks, shapewear, hosiery and T-shirts than any other company.  We take great pride in our strong reputation for ethical business practices and the success of our Hanes for Good corporate responsibility program for workplace practices and community and environmental improvement. The company is the only apparel producer to ever be honored by the Great Place to Work Institute for its workplace practices in Central America and the Caribbean. In the United States, the company has earned the Forbes magazine Best Place to Work honor. Hanes has won U.S. Environmental Protection Agency Energy Star sustained excellence recognition for seven consecutive years. Hanes has significant goals for reducing energy use, carbon emissions and water use and publicly reports its progress each year. More information about our Hanes for Good corporate responsibility initiatives may be found at www.HanesForGood.com
summary: HanesBrands is a global leader in basic apparel, offering a wide range of comfortable, durable, and ethically produced clothing items, including bras, panties, underwear, socks, T-shirts, and activewear. title: Glitter AmberWatch
features:
Children's Loud Alert Safety Watch
Protect your child from predators and other threats
Digital watch with full features
Hip, cute style and color
One year warranty
description:
AmberWatch has created a children's digital watch that arms our children against child predators and and other threats. The AmberWatch was designed with a security system that draws attention to children in trouble by using an audio and visual alert system. When a child is in trouble he or she just pushes the two red buttons and the AmberWatch alert is triggered. With sound blaring at 115dB, which can be heard 100+ yards away, and super bright LEDs flashing a visible warning alert, attention is brought to the child in danger helping minimize the risk of abduction or injury. Includes batteries,quickstart guide, and 1 yr warranty card. Please arm your children with the AmberWatch and keep all of our children safe. For every watch sold AmberWatch donates proceeds to the AmberWatch foundation-a nonprofit organization dedicated to the prevention of child abduction and child endangerment.
The most effective means of protecting children from predators is giving them tools to prevent abduction. The AmberWatch was designed to complement safety plans made with parents and to aid in an immediate escape. It is a 115-decibel alarm built into a watch that, when activated, can be heard from 100 yards away. An unmistakable distress signal, it draws attention to dangerous situations and helps children respond strongly when they feel threatened. It can also come into use when a child is lost in a store, park or crowd, when theyre threatened by an animal, if theyre hurt, or if they get lost while participating in activities such as camping, skiing or hiking. The watch has a bulky modern style and super-bright LED lights that can be seen night or day. Digital functions include time, date, alarm, stopwatch, day of the week, low battery and backlight. The alarm is activated by pushing both of the red buttons on either side of the face and deactivated using the same 2 buttons in a coded sequence you set yourself. A special break-away back-up system automatically activates the alarm if the watch is forcibly removed. Amber Watch donates $1 to the AmberWatch Foundation for every watch sold. Water resistant. Adjusts to 6 sizes, approx. 5-3/4L" to 7-3/4L". Purple glitter bezel with a purple band.
Features and Benefits
Emits 115 decibels Super bright LED lights Special break-away back-up system Multiple functions Fashionable and life-saving
summary: AmberWatch is a children's digital watch designed for safety, featuring an alarm system with 115dB sound and bright LED lights triggered by two red buttons. It includes a breakaway backup system, digital functions, a year warranty, and a portion of proceeds donated to the AmberWatch Foundation for child safety.

features:
Quartz movement
Metal case; Orange-and-blue dial
Not water resistant
Package Dimensions:
                    
5.6 x 2.1 x 1 inches
Shipping Weight:
                    
3.2 ounces
description:
Harry Potter Unisex #HC0414
This whimsical Harry Potter collectible watch is a playful reproduction of the famous grandfather clock used by the diligent Mrs. Weasley to track the location and well-being of her family members at all times.  The goldtone case highlights a blue inner dial framed by a swirling orange outer dial featuring possible locations and states of being.  Oval-tipped goldtone hands point to Quidditch, School, Travel, Home, Dentist, Prison, Lost, and--most ominously--Mortal Peril. (Note how the danger seems to grow with the advancing hour!)  In case you want to know the time as well, simple goldtone dot markers on the inner dial do the job nicely.  There's even a second hand, for those who value precision.  The watch is showcased on a mahogany leather strap with a buckle closure and comes packaged in a fiery red and orange Goblet of Fire collectible tin.
summary: Harry Potter-themed collectible watch with a whimsical grandfather clock design, featuring a dial with possible locations and states of being (including 'Mortal Peril'), quartz movement, mahogany leather strap, and comes in a Goblet of Fire collectible tin.

title: Graphite Sport AmberWatch
features:
Children's Loud Alert Safety Watch
Protect your child from predators and other threats
Digital watch with full features
Hip, cute style and color
One year warranty
description:
The most effective means of protecting children from predators is giving them tools to prevent abduction. The AmberWatch was designed to complement safety plans made with parents and to aid in an immediate escape. It is a 115-decibel alarm built into a watch that, when activated, can be heard from 100 yards away. An unmistakable distress signal, it draws attention to dangerous situations and helps children respond strongly when they feel threatened. It can also come into use when a child is lost in a store, park or crowd, when theyre threatened by an animal, if theyre hurt, or if they get lost while participating in activities such as camping, skiing or hiking. The watch has a bulky modern style and super-bright LED lights that can be seen night or day. Digital functions include time, date, alarm, stopwatch, day of the week, low battery and backlight. The alarm is activated by pushing both of the red buttons on either side of the face and deactivated using the same 2 buttons in a coded sequence you set yourself. A special break-away back-up system automatically activates the alarm if the watch is forcibly removed. Amber Watch donates $1 to the AmberWatch Foundation for every watch sold. Water resistant. Adjusts to 6 sizes, approx. 5-3/4L" to 7-3/4L".
Features and Benefits
Emits 115 decibels Super bright LED lights Special break-away back-up system Multiple functions Fashionable and life-saving
summary: AmberWatch is a 115-dB personal alarm watch for kids featuring a breakaway backup system, bright LED lights, and digital functions. It empowers children with safety tools to prevent abduction, aid in escape, and alert others in dangerous situations, lost scenarios, or during outdoor activities.

description:
Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: Casio, renowned for its digital watch innovations since 1974, specializes in solar-powered and radio-controlled timepieces, offering battery-free and accurate timekeeping. Recently, Casio has introduced Bluetooth-enabled watches that automatically synchronize with smartphones for time updates, demonstrating its commitment to advancing timekeeping technology.

description:
This Timex Watch (but not any battery, crystal, band, or strap) is warranted to the owner for a period of ONE YEAR from the date of purchase against defects in manufacture by Timex Corporation. Timex will not repair defects relating to servicing not performed by Timex Corporation. This limited warranty applies to US Customers.
The Timex Kids watch (model T7B421) is reliable, durable, and readable in the dark, thanks to the integrated Indiglo night-light. But it's also flat-out fun to wear. It has a durable blue resin case and lime-green bezel framing a white dial, which is complemented by a full Arabic numeral display in stylized script, luminous red hands (with seconds hand), and an illustrated ladybug and shamrocks. It's completed by a comfortable orange elastic fabric strap for better dirt and stain resistance. This watch also offers water resistance to 100 meters (330 feet) and Timex's unique Kids Loss Protection Plan. It's recommended for children ages 6 and older.
The Indiglo night-light uniformly lights the surface of the watch dial using patented blue electroluminescent lighting technology. It uses less battery power than most other watch illumination systems, enabling your watch battery to last longer.
Timex understands that kids often lose things, even their most prized possessions, which is why this watch is covered by the Timex Kids Loss Protection Plan. If the watch is lost, Timex will replace it with the same style (or similar if your style is not available) at the price of $10 for up to one year from the original date of purchase, with no questions asked. Details are included in the printed instructions that come with the watch.
summary: Timex's waterproof Kids' watch (model T7B421) is fun, durable, and readable in the dark with its Indiglo night-light. The watch comes with a one-year warranty against manufacturing defects for US customers. It also offers a Kids Loss Protection Plan that allows for a discounted replacement in case of loss. Features include quartz movement, mineral crystal, and water resistance up to 99 feet (30 M).

Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. Tinkerbell adorns the red dial just below the digital display, while above the display reads the phrase "Pixie Paradise." This digital-quartz-powered watch is a great first watch for any young girl. As an added bonus, it comes with a matching red plastic pencil case and a delicate flower necklace.
Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: Enchanting Disney Tinker Bell watch gift set includes a durable red plastic watch with a blue bezel, adorned with Tinkerbell on its red dial, and a matching pencil case and flower necklace.

title: Nike Kids' K0007-344 Triax Roar Watch
features:
Quartz movement
Case diameter: 31 mm
Stainless-steel-and-polyurethane case; Blue dial

Product Dimensions:

description:
Lightweight, durable sport watch Nike Triax timepiece designed with stainless steel and black plastic case Watch features blue dial with luminous hands and white numbers Mineral crystal Water resistant to 50 meters Black plastic strap Tang buckle Case dimensions: 32mm wide x 11mm thick Strap dimensions: 9mm wide x 7.5 inches long All measurements are approximate and may vary slightly from the listed dimensions. This watch band can be sized to fit 6.5-inch to 7.5-inch wrists.
Nicely affordable and made to withstand the punishing play of today's active kids, the Nike Triax Roar analog watch offers a sleek, sporty style. It has an aluminum face shield that takes blows without flinching and a stainless steel back plate that can withstand serious play. The watch case and pre-curved green polyurethane strap form a unique S-shaped design that curves comfortably around the wrist for an improved fit and quicker reading of the time. It features a large, easily readable dial face in blue with luminous hands (with seconds hand) and silver Arabic numeral markers (with larger font size at the quarter hours). Other features include a scratch-resistant mineral glass crystal and water resistance to 50 meters--suitable for swimming but not for diving.
About Nike Nike watches are built to endure extreme outdoor conditions without missing a beat and they adhere to the company's founding mission statement: to bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete in the world. And as Nike co-founder Bill Bowerman would add--if you have a body, you're an athlete. Ever since the fateful day in 1971 when University of Oregon track coach Bowerman poured rubber into his wife's waffle iron, technological innovation has been the spark that lights Nike's fire. The Waffle outsole transformed the running world and soon after Nike Air evolved Nike's revolutionary impact on sports. Beyond shoes--from watches and eyewear to carry gear and even socks--Nike is committed to giving athletes of every make, model and body style, who compete and recreate in ways never before imagined, the very best performance product. Here are just a few important dates in Nike's journey:  American record-holder Steve Prefontaine becomes the first major track athlete to wear Nike brand shoes in 1973. At the 1976 Olympic Trials, Nike shoes are seen in abundance for the first time--worn by young, rising stars in both middle- and long-distance events. The first athlete to win an Olympic medal wearing Nike shoes is British runner, Steve Ovett in the 1980 Moscow Games The Just Do It advertising campaign began in 1988, and is now ensconced in the Americana exhibit at the Smithsonian National Museum.
summary: The Nike Triax Roar is a lightweight and durable sport watch designed for kids. It features a stainless steel case, black plastic strap, blue dial with luminous hands and white numbers, and is water-resistant to 50 meters. The watch has a unique S-shaped design that fits comfortably around the wrist, and the large, easily readable dial face makes it easy to tell the time. The Nike Triax Roar is a great choice for active kids who want a stylish and functional watch.

summary: Nike Triax Roar analog watch offers sleek, sporty style with an aluminum face shield, stainless steel back plate, S-shaped design for comfortable fit, large readable dial face, luminous hands, scratch-resistant mineral glass crystal, water resistance to 50 meters (suitable for swimming), from Nike, a brand known for innovation and durability in extreme outdoor conditions.

Build it before you wear it! Take LEGOS to the next level with this colorful, cool and completely customizable timepiece. The band attaches directly to the plastic bezel and can be customized even further by clicking on one of three colored (blue, red or yellow) bezel rings. A dark, stylized mineral-material face illuminates light-colored easy-to-read numbers and hands. This watch is water resistant up to 99 feet and features analog-quartz movement, for reliability and resilience. This is for LEGO fans of all ages  the band length is completely customizable by adding more pieces. Just snap and go!
Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: Customize your wristwatch with this LEGO-compatible timepiece featuring interchangeable bands, bezel rings, and a durable design with quartz movement, mineral crystal, and water resistance up to 99 feet.

description:
Build it your way! This iconic watch from LEGO will allow you and your little ones to have fun building a classic LEGO building toy. This watch comes with multi-coloured, interchangeable links and an easy-to-read watch face that is not only exciting but also comfortable and durable. This LEGO watch comes with accessories, which offer plenty of design possibilities. Kids can add links to build their own unique watch.
With a bright, cheery style LEGO aficionados of all ages are sure to love, the LEGO Kids' Make-N-Create Watch has a fun, interlocking strap comprised of interchangeable links in yellow, green, blue and red. Recommended for kids six and older, this fun timepiece has a bright white dial with clear, easy-to-read Arabic numbers and minute track -- perfect for those just learning to tell time -- while Japanese quartz movement ensures accuracy and reliability. For durability, this watch also has a mineral crystal and is water resistant to 165 feet (50 meters). Perfect for sensitive skin, it's both nickel and PVC free, and comes complete with a non-allergenic polycarbonate case. For extra fun, it also includes a "Make-N-Create" fish model.
summary: LEGO Kids' Make-N-Create Watch offers customizable link building with interchangeable, colored links. Features easy-to-read Arabic numerals, Japanese quartz movement for precision, mineral crystal protection, and water resistance up to 50 meters. Nickel-free, PVC-free, and non-allergenic for sensitive skin, includes a 'Make-N-Create' fish model for added fun.

description:
Cute and colorful, this Kids' Watch from Activa is a playfully designed yet useful timepiece. A charming cartoon-style character peeks out from the bright pink dial, and the matching band of bright pink rubber features silly pale pink paw prints and other fun images along its length. The large black numbers of the indexes and the white tips of the watch hands make it easier to tell time; the red seconds hand comes in a silly-wiggle design. The 14-millimeter band closes with a secure buckle clasp, and the 29-millimeter case and round bezel are made of durable and shiny stainless steel. This analog-quartz-powered watch is water resistant up to 99 feet.

description:
If your little one loves Shrek, you're sure to light up their eyes with this adorable wristwatch from Armitron. Built with a durable bright green resin case and a simple blue-colored nylon band with a simple Velcro closure clasp, this digital watch makes telling time easy and hip. Your child will jump for joy with Shrek, Donkey, and Puss in Boots adorning their wrist, and to top it all off the watch comes in a humorous Shrek-shaped box that features cool, spring-loaded green ears.
Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: This adorable Armitron digital watch features Shrek, Donkey, and Puss in Boots, making it a perfect gift for children who love Shrek. Its durable construction and bright green resin case make it both stylish and functional.

description:
Any Bionicle fan would love to tell time with this Rakshi watch by LEGO. The gray dial face features a Bionicle image along with easy-to-read numbered indexes. The non-allergenic poly-carbonite band has interactive, snap-together parts in gray, orange and black that allow for adjustable lengths; a clip-on clasp is used for closure. The case and bezel are also made of non-allergenic poly-carbonite, and the interchangeable bezel allows you to mix and match the array of included Bionicle watch accessories for additional fun. This durable, analog-quartz watch is water resistant up to 165 feet, so it is as ready for adventure as the Bionicle watch wearer. Additional Info: Plastic Case Rakshi, Removable watch head. Easy-to-read dial. Hypoallergenic case back. 4 tough-wearing LEGO links in assorted colors. 10 LEGO stud links. LEGO clasp. 2 interchangeable bezels. Nickel free/PVC free. 2 interchangeable Bionicle masks which fit over the watch face. Battery included. 1 year manufacturer's warranty. Lego watch parts are interchangeable across the LEGO watch ranges. Create your own watch!
Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: The LEGO Bionicle Rakshi watch features an adjustable poly-carbonite band, interchangeable Bionicle mask bezels, and a water-resistant analog-quartz design. With its durable construction and hypoallergenic materials, it's perfect for Bionicle enthusiasts and adventure-seekers alike.

LEGO Watches
The name LEGO is an abbreviation of the Danish words leg godt, meaning play well. Its our name and our ideal.
The LEGO Group was founded in 1932 by Ole Kirk Christiansen. The company has passed from father to son and remains a family-owned business even today, owned by Kjeld Kirk Kristiansen, a grandchild of the founder.
It has come a long way over the past decadesfrom a small carpenters workshop to a modern, global enterprise. The LEGO Group is a privately held company based in Billund, Denmark. The company is still owned by the Kirk Kristiansen family, who founded it in 1932.
The LEGO Group is engaged in the development of childrens creativity through playing and learning, and it is this core philosophy that is built into every LEGO brand watch and clock.

Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: Interchangeable Lego-link watch with assorted colors, Clikits components, and interchangeable bezels, featuring quartz movement, hypoallergenic poly-carbonite case, and 165ft water resistance.

Sizes 3/6 mos, 6/12 mos, 12/18 mos and 2/3 yrs have snaps on the inside of legs for easy diaper changing. Available for baby girls, infants and toddlers from 3 months up to 7 years.THE TUGA DIFFERENCETuga Sunwear is functional and fashionable UV protection apparel and accessories. Our patterns are designed to be form fitting and to incorporate stylish cuts. Through the use of colorful designs, we make sure kids are looking the best at the beach or the pool. We use fabrics that are made specifically, both through the knitting and dying process, to meet the 50+ UPF standards of blocking 98% of UV rays (both UVA and UVB) while still being free of chemical sunscreens and great for sensitive skin. Our products are Skin Safe and Reef Safe!Now, Go Play, Weve Got You Covered! 100% product guarantee. No questions asked.UPF vs SPFPretty much the same thing. UPF is a rating for clothing and indicates the level of sun protection. The higher the better! UPF 50+ blocks 98% of UV rays. It is also critical that the protection you choose blocks both UVA and UVB rays. Tuga swimwear does and our fabrics are free of sunscreen chemicals!SIZINGUse age, weight and height as a starting point for children, but please use actual product measurements for best fit. Unless otherwise stated, all our clothing is designed with a regular, comfort fit and not fitted in order to provide the highest sun protection possible. Please check our Tuga Sunwear size charts to ensure the best fit.
summary: Tuga Girls' High Tide Sunsuit provides excellent UPF 50+ protection for kids from 3 months to 7 years, featuring a one-piece long-sleeve design with easy-on zipper, diaper snaps in smaller sizes, and adorable turtle print. Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.

Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
summary: This Hannah Montana watch features a charm-style bracelet with silver-tone charms, a silver dial with Arabic numerals and Hannah's image, a 24-millimeter stainless steel case, quartz movement, and a lobster clasp.

MZBerger & Company is a design, marketing and distribution company that specializes in products designed with fashion and value in mind. The name ‘LEGO’ is an abbreviation of the two Danish words “leg godt”, meaning “play well”. It’s our name and it’s our ideal.
The LEGO Group was founded in 1932 by Ole Kirk Christiansen. The Company has passed from father to son and remains a family owned business even today: Owned by Kjeld Kirk Kristiansen, a grandchild of the founder.
It has come a long way over the past almost 80 years – from a small carpenter’s workshop to a modern, global enterprise.
The LEGO Group is a privately held company based in Billund, Denmark. The company is still owned by the Kirk Kristiansen family who founded it in 1932.
The LEGO Group is engaged in the development of children’s creativity through playing and learning and it is this core philosophy that is built into every LEGO brand watch and clock.

Timex Elastic Frog Band Kids Watch T7B705.

Timex Group B.V. is one of the best-known American watch companies. Timex's U.S. headquarters are located in Middlebury Connecticut and it has substantial operations in China, the Philippines and India and full scale sales companies in Canada, the UK, France and Mexico.
The company began in 1854 as Waterbury Clock in Connecticut's Naugatuck Valley, known during the nineteenth century as the "Switzerland of America." Sister company Waterbury Watch manufactured the first inexpensive mechanical pocket watch in 1880. During World War I, Waterbury began making wristwatches, which had only just become popular, and in 1933 it made history by creating the first Mickey Mouse clock under license from Walt Disney, with Mickey's hands pointing the time.
During World War II, Waterbury renamed itself U.S. Time Company. In 1950 the company introduced a wristwatch called the Timex. Over the next three decades, Timex was sold through a series of advertisements which emphasized its durability by putting the watch through "torture tests," such as falling over the Grand Coulee Dam or being strapped to the propeller of an outboard motor, with the slogan "It takes a licking and keeps on ticking." With the help of former Olympic broadcaster, spokesman John Cameron Swayze, sales took off. The company later became Timex Corporation, then Timex Group and, to date, has sold over one billion watches.
The company has remained very competitive and the Timex brand continues its dominance through present day. Its primary market remains the United States and Canada, although the Timex brand is sold worldwide due to its ability to capitalize on its strong brand image and reputation for quality.
One of the most successful and important features available on many Timex watches is the Indiglo backlight system. Indiglo is a brand name of Indiglo Corporation, solely owned by Timex for licensing purposes. Timex electroluminescent lamps, branded Indiglo, were introduced in 1992 in the Ironman watch line. They were an immediate success. The Indiglo lamp uniformly lights the surface of the Timexs watch dials in a manner that makes the dial read very easily in many different light settings. In some newer watches the Indiglo backlight only lights up the numbers, rather than the entire LCD display, which is achieved by means of a specialized film that inverts the LCD transmissivity.
Today, Timex Group products are manufactured in the Far East and in Switzerland often based on technology that continues to be developed in the United States and in Germany. With a large and varied line of watches, Timex has the style for everyone. From the locker room to the board room, there is a great Timex style time-piece for you.
summary: Youthful plastic watch with a green frog print canvas strap. Features a fixed bezel, white dial, pink and yellow hands, Arabic hour markers, quartz movement, Indiglo night-light, water resistance to 30 meters, and a 29 mm case diameter and 11 mm thickness.

features:

description:
This Timex Watch (but not any battery, crystal, band, or strap) is warranted to the owner for a period of ONE YEAR from the date of purchase against defects in manufacture by Timex Corporation. Timex will not repair defects relating to servicing not performed by Timex Corporation. This limited warranty applies to US Customers.

Timex Group B.V. is one of the best-known American watch companies. Timex's U.S. headquarters are located in Middlebury Connecticut and it has substantial operations in China, the Philippines and India and full scale sales companies in Canada, the UK, France and Mexico.
The company began in 1854 as Waterbury Clock in Connecticut's Naugatuck Valley, known during the nineteenth century as the "Switzerland of America." Sister company Waterbury Watch manufactured the first inexpensive mechanical pocket watch in 1880. During World War I, Waterbury began making wristwatches, which had only just become popular, and in 1933 it made history by creating the first Mickey Mouse clock under license from Walt Disney, with Mickey's hands pointing the time.
During World War II, Waterbury renamed itself U.S. Time Company. In 1950 the company introduced a wristwatch called the Timex. Over the next three decades, Timex was sold through a series of advertisements which emphasized its durability by putting the watch through "torture tests," such as falling over the Grand Coulee Dam or being strapped to the propeller of an outboard motor, with the slogan "It takes a licking and keeps on ticking." With the help of former Olympic broadcaster, spokesman John Cameron Swayze, sales took off. The company later became Timex Corporation, then Timex Group and, to date, has sold over one billion watches.
The company has remained very competitive and the Timex brand continues its dominance through present day. Its primary market remains the United States and Canada, although the Timex brand is sold worldwide due to its ability to capitalize on its strong brand image and reputation for quality.
One of the most successful and important features available on many Timex watches is the Indiglo backlight system. Indiglo is a brand name of Indiglo Corporation, solely owned by Timex for licensing purposes. Timex electroluminescent lamps, branded Indiglo, were introduced in 1992 in the Ironman watch line. They were an immediate success. The Indiglo lamp uniformly lights the surface of the Timex’s watch dials in a manner that makes the dial read very easily in many different light settings. In some newer watches the Indiglo backlight only lights up the numbers, rather than the entire LCD display, which is achieved by means of a specialized film that inverts the LCD transmissivity.
Today, Timex Group products are manufactured in the Far East and in Switzerland often based on technology that continues to be developed in the United States and in Germany. With a large and varied line of watches, Timex has the style for everyone. From the locker room to the board room, there is a great Timex style time-piece for you.
summary: The specified Timex watch, excluding any battery, crystal, band, or strap, carries a one-year warranty from the purchase date against manufacturing defects. This warranty applies only to US customers and excludes repairs performed outside of Timex Corporation.

Casio
With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.
Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
